intro: Tomanthera, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Americas. The plants are typically herbaceous, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that resemble those of the dandelion. Tomanthera species often grow in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. They are characterized by their milky sap and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
